derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'whirl (someone or something) round'): from late Latin gyrare, from Latin gyrus 'a ring', from Greek guros. The noun is from Latin gyrus

means.word_mean: 1. a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles
